intro: Hieracium rectum subsp. praerectum, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early autumn, producing yellow flowers that attract various pollinators. It is often found in grasslands, meadows, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
